title: "Maintain Your Combine: Essential Maintenance for John Deere S Series"

tasks.task: Performing combine harvester maintenance before the harvest season.
subtasks: Check engine oil and coolant levels.
Examine belts and chains for proper tension and wear.
Inspect the cutting platform, including knives and guards.
Check the threshing mechanism and cleaning shoe.
Clean out debris from the previous season.
Test all lights and safety equipment.

tasks.task: Conduct daily combine harvester maintenance during the harvest season.
subtasks: Grease all fittings as per the manufacturer's recommendations.
Check fluid levels including engine oil, hydraulic oil, and coolant.
Inspect belts and chains for proper tension.
Clean the radiator and other cooling components.
Empty the rock trap.
Check tire pressure and adjust.
Clean the grain tank and unloading auger.

tasks.task: Perform post-harvest care for the combine harvester.
subtasks: Clean crop residue from the machine.
Check for loose or missing bolts.
Inspect the header for damage or wear.
Look for oil leaks and address them.
Give the combine a thorough cleaning.
Remove all crop residue.
Change all fluids and filters.
Lubricate necessary points.
Touch up paint to prevent rust.

tasks.task: Troubleshooting common issues with the combine harvester.
subtasks: Check sickle sections and guards for uneven cutting.
Adjust concave clearance and rotor speed for inconsistent threshing.
Inspect sieves and adjust fan speed for grain loss.
Check fuel filters and lines for contamination if experiencing engine problems.
Look for leaks and check fluid levels for hydraulic issues.
